channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MI

item.title: Report E-2025020104
item.description:
Report E-2025020104

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-15T03:17:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-07
  • City: JACKSON
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 7, 2025, one (1) 5,000 pound supersack of Eka SC was damaged during loading and released approximately one (1) pound of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the sire. The crew collected the spent product into one (1) 5-gallon pail and all debris/PPE was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew transferred the contents of the supersack into one (1) new sack.

item.title: Report I-2025010023
item.description:
Report I-2025010023

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-11
  • City: DETROIT
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PVS CHEMICAL SOLUTIONS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Tank was not in driver's sight. Site representative was watching the tank and notified driver to stop offloading once approximately 50 gallons of Sodium Bisulfite overflowed into containment. The site suspected the gaging system was not functioning. No Injuries/Exposure.
